intro: Hieracium murorum var. siljense, commonly known as the Siljens' hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, dark green leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
